intro: Valeriana zamoranensis, commonly known as Zamora valerian, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Valeriana zamoranensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its calming effects.
